content.text: Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) causes two-thirds of the cases of vaginal cancer. Vaccines that protect against infection with HPV may reduce the risk of vaginal cancer. When found early, vaginal cancer can often be cured. Explore the links on this page to learn more about vaginal cancer treatment, research, and clinical trials.
NCI does not have PDQ evidence-based information about prevention of vaginal cancer.
NCI does not have PDQ evidence-based information about screening for vaginal cancer.
The information in this section is meant to help you cope with the many issues and concerns that occur when you have cancer.
Gardasil 9 Vaccine Protects against Additional HPV Types

National Cancer Institute
at the National Institutes of Health
